New York City faces severe winter weather challenges, with eight fatalities reported amid freezing temperatures, school closures due to snow, and ongoing flood advisories, while local officials address public safety and housing issues, including a federal investigation involving a top adviser to Mayor Eric Adams.

### Risks & Alerts

- 8 people found dead outside in NYC since Saturday amid below-freezing temps. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMipAFBVV95cUxPXzdLOV9taldsd1hkYUlpQTVmZVBlOEtiM1dKSER5TEFQTVV1T2lGV0xNTk9NMG9waXh1VFluc0tvWWdMMnI3cFB1T2pUNHdEUjJhcGJHMTNacnZobWI2M19wZE4zc2c4dzlZZUNHbmJPLUQ5aGNKUmFoWWwyMmg0RExPZUdHbkx0UV9EWVJXQ3huNjBwRDYxc2NlWV9KSEltSGxfWA?oc=5)
- Hudson County school closures and delayed openings due to snow and ice storm on Tuesday, January 27. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Coastal flood advisory in effect for Staten Island after heavy snow. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Water main break disrupts service and prompts repairs in Staten Island neighborhood. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
